module.name: ComCtrls
module.short: Several controls commonly used in Lazarus forms

element.name: TStatusPanel
element.short: TStatusPanel - one of the panels contained in a StatusBar

element.name: TStatusPanel.StatusBar
element.short: The StatusBar that contains this StatusPanel

element.name: TStatusPanel.Alignment
element.short: Alignment - whether left- or right-justified or centered

element.name: TStatusPanel.Bevel
element.short: The type of Bevel for the display

element.name: TStatusPanel.Style
element.short: Style - whether text or something drawn by the owner

element.name: TStatusPanel.Text
element.short: Text - the string for display in the StatusBar

element.name: TStatusPanel.Width
element.short: The Width of this panel on the StatusBar

element.name: TStatusPanels
element.short: TStatusPanels - the collection of Status Panels in this StatusBar

element.name: TStatusPanels.StatusBar
element.short: The StatusBar to which this collection of Status Panels belongs

element.name: TStatusBar
element.short: TStatusBar - a strip along the bottom of a form for displaying information on current status

descr.p: TStatusBar - a strip along the bottom of a form for displaying information on current status
The bar may consist of a single SimplePanel, in which case the displayed text is contained in SimpleText.
However if SimplePanel is false, then there can be multiple panels or sub-sections of the status bar, whose properties are described in Panels.
The property SimpleText can be assigned programatically to display the value of some variable, such as the position of the Splitter in the example

element.name: TStatusBar.Canvas
element.short: The Canvas where the Panels of the StatusBar are to be Painted

element.name: TStatusBar.Panels
element.short: Panels - the list of strings to be placed in the sub-panels of TStatusBar

descr.p: If SimplePanel is false, the contents of Panels is displayed.

Contents can be adjusted with a stringlist editor that pops up when the ellipsis (...) next to Panels in the Object Inspector is selected and allows insertion of an arbitrary number of sub-panels with their own strings

element.name: TStatusBar.SimpleText
element.short: SimpleText - a character string containing the information to be displayed in the Status Bar

descr.p: SimpleText - a character string containing the information to be displayed in the Status Bar
This is displayed if SimplePanel is true; otherwise the information in Panels is displayed.

element.name: TStatusBar.SimplePanel
element.short: SimplePanel - boolean. Is there just one continuous panel, or several sub-panels?

descr.p: SimplePanel - boolean. Is there just one continuous panel, or several sub-panels?
If true, the value of SimpleText is displayed; if false, the contents of Panels is displayed.
Contents can be adjusted with a stringlist editor that pops up when the ellipsis (...) next to Panels is selected and allows insertion of an arbitrary number of sub-panels with their own strings

element.name: TStatusBar.OnHint
element.short: Event handler for showing a hint when required

element.name: TTabSheet
element.short: TTabSheet - individual page of a TPageControl; a more elaborate version of TPage

descr.p: TTabSheet - individual page of a TPageControl; a more elaborate version of TPage
Contains the following features lacked by TPage:

ul.li: Ability to make the Tab visible or not

element.name: TTabSheet.PageControl
element.short: The PageControl of which this TabSheet is a member

element.name: TTabSheet.TabIndex
element.short: TabIndex - the Index value or sequence number of this TabSheet

element.name: TPageControl
element.short: TPageControl - provides a series of tabs along the edge of a multi-page component, to allow selection of one of the pages (TTabSheet) of the component.

descr.p: TPageControl - provides a series of tabs along the edge of a multi-page component, to allow selection of one of the pages (TTabSheet) of the component.
To use TPageControl, select its icon from the Common Controls tab of the IDE Component Palette, and place it at the desired location on the Form.

Use the Form Designer and Object Inspector to adjust its shape, size, alignment, anchoring, docking and other properties, then select the object and right click with the mouse to bring up a pop-up menu whose frst item is 'AddPage'. After you have added as many pages as you need, the individual pages can be edited by selecting ActivePage in the Object Inspector, choosing the page required, and editing its properties.
While a given page is selected, it is also possible to drop other controls (such as buttons, memo boxes etc) on to the page from the Component Palette.

element.name: TPageControl.FindNextPage
element.short: FindNextPage - returns the next page (TTabSheet) in the sequence

element.name: TPageControl.SelectNextPage
element.short: SelectNextPage - checking that its tab is visible

element.name: TPageControl.ActivePageIndex
element.short: ActivePageIndex - index value of currently selected (active) page

element.name: TPageControl.Pages
element.short: Pages - the actual Pages (TTabSheet) that comprise the component

element.name: TPageControl.ActivePage
element.short: ActivePage - the currently selected active page (TTabSheet)

descr.p: ActivePage - the currently selected active page (TTabSheet)
Note that this overrides the definition in TCustomNoteBook, where ActivePage is defined as a String.

element.name: TPageControl.TabIndex
element.short: TabIndex - the Index value of the currently selected Tab

element.name: TPageControl.OnChange
element.short: OnChange - event handler for a change in the current page

element.name: TTabControlStrings
element.short: TTabControlStrings - the Strings that appear on the tabs of TTabControl

element.name: TTabControlStrings.GetTabIndex
element.short: GetTabIndex - returns the Index value of the current Tab

element.name: TTabControlStrings.GetHitTestInfoAt
element.short: GetHitTestInfoAt - returns the results of a hit test at the specified location X, Y

element.name: TTabControlStrings.GetSize
element.short: GetSize - returns the size of the tab string

element.name: TTabControlStrings.IndexOfTabAt
element.short: IndexOfTabAt - returns the Index value of the tab at the specified location, X, Y

element.name: TTabControlStrings.RowCount
element.short: RowCount - number of rows (for a multi-row string)

element.name: TTabControlStrings.TabRect
element.short: TabRec - returns the coordinates of the rectangle for the tab with specified index

element.name: TTabControlStrings.TabControl
element.short: The TabControl to which these strings apply

element.name: TTabControlStrings.TabIndex
element.short: TabIndex - the index of the current Tab

element.name: TTabControlStrings.Images
element.short: The list of Images associated with the Strings for these tabs

element.name: TTabControlStrings.MultiLine
element.short: MultiLine - if True, multiple lines may be used in Tab strings

element.name: TTabControlStrings.MultiSelect
element.short: MultiSelect - if True, multiple tabs can be selected, for example by holding down Shift or Ctrl keys while selecting

element.name: TTabControlStrings.OwnerDraw
element.short: OwnerDraw - if True, Owner object (or calling routine) can specify drawing methods

element.name: TTabControlStrings.RaggedRight
element.short: RaggedRight - if True, strings are un-justified or un-aligned, with ragged right margin

element.name: TTabControlStrings.ScrollOpposite
element.short: ScrollOpposite - if True, scrolling proceeds in opposite direction to usual

element.name: TTabControlStrings.TabHeight
element.short: TabHeight- height of the tab

element.name: TTabControlStrings.TabWidth
element.short: TabWidth - width of the tab

element.name: TTabControlNoteBookStrings
element.short: TTabControlNoteBookStrings - instance of TTabControlStrings for use with a TNoteBook

element.name: TTabControlNoteBookStrings.NoteBook
element.short: The NoteBook for which the tab strings are to be used

element.name: TCustomTabControl
element.short: TCustomTabControl - base class for TTabControl, a series of Tabs along the edge of a display area; selection of a Tab governs the contents of the DisplayRect
element.descr: TCustomTabControl - base class for TTabControl, a series of Tabs along the edge of a display area; selection of a Tab governs the contents of the DisplayRect

element.name: TCustomTabControl.DisplayRect
element.short: DisplayRect - the rectangular area to be used for displaying information determined by the identity of the selected Tab

element.name: TCustomTabControl.Images
element.short: Images - the list of Images available for display in the DisplayRect

element.name: TCustomTabControl.MultiLine
element.short: MultiLine - whether the Tab's caption is allowed to have multiple lines

element.name: TCustomTabControl.MultiSelect
element.short: MultiSelect - whether multiple Tabs are allowed to be selected at the same time (eg by pressing Shift or Ctrl while selecting)

element.name: TCustomTabControl.OnChange
element.short: OnChange - event handler for a change in the Tabs

element.name: TCustomTabControl.OnChanging
element.short: OnChanging - event handler while Tab is changing

element.name: TCustomTabControl.OnDrawTab
element.short: OnDrawTab - event handler for drawing a Tab

element.name: TCustomTabControl.OnGetImageIndex
element.short: OnGetImageIndex - event handler for finding the index value of the required image

element.name: TCustomTabControl.OwnerDraw
element.short: OwnerDraw - is the calling routine (Owner) allowed to specify the drawing method?

element.name: TCustomTabControl.RaggedRight
element.short: RaggedRight - un-justified or un-aligned text

element.name: TCustomTabControl.ScrollOpposite
element.short: ScrollOpposite - is scrolling to happen in the opposite direction to usual?

element.name: TCustomTabControl.Style
element.short: Style - Tabs, buttons or flat buttons?

element.name: TCustomTabControl.TabHeight
element.short: TabHeight - height of the tabs

element.name: TCustomTabControl.TabIndex
element.short: TabIndex - index value of current Tab. If none selected, default value of -1 is returned

element.name: TCustomTabControl.TabPosition
element.short: TabPosition - top, bottom, left or right

element.name: TCustomTabControl.Tabs
element.short: Tabs - the actual Tabs expressed as strings

element.name: TCustomTabControl.TabWidth
element.short: TabWidth - width of the tabs

element.name: TCustomTabControl.IndexOfTabAt
element.short: IndexOfTabAt - returns the index value of the Tab located at specified X, Y

element.name: TCustomTabControl.GetHitTestInfoAt
element.short: GetHitTestInfoAt - returns information about hit tests at location X, Y

element.name: TCustomTabControl.TabRect
element.short: TabRect - the rectangle occupied by the specified Tab

element.name: TCustomTabControl.RowCount
element.short: RowCount - the number of rows in the list of tabs

element.name: TCustomTabControl.ScrollTabs
element.short: ScrollTabs - scroll through the list of tabs by an amount specifid by Delta

element.name: TCustomTabControl.BeginUpdate
element.short: BeginUpdate - start the Update procedure

element.name: TCustomTabControl.EndUpdate
element.short: EndUpdate - finish the update procedure

element.name: TCustomTabControl.IsUpdating
element.short: IsUpdating - returns True if in process of updating

element.name: TTabControl
element.short: TTabControl - a series of Tabs along the edge of a display area; selection of a Tab governs the contents of the DisplayRect

descr.p: TTabControl - a series of Tabs along the edge of a display area; selection of a Tab governs the contents of the DisplayRect

Use TTabControl by selecting its icon from the Common Controls tab of the IDE Component Palette and placing it at the desired location on the Form. Use the Form Designer and Object Inspector to adjust its shape, size, alignment, anchoring and other properties. Tabs can be aded or removed from the component by selecting it, then right-clicking with the mouse to get a pop-up menu whose first item is 'Add Tab'. Once created, the Tabs can be edited by selecting the Tabs entry in the Object Inspector, and selecting the ellipsis (...) which will cause a pop-up String editor to appear. The tabs can be given new captions, moved up and down the list, or removed altogether, as required.
Each Tab has an Index (starting from 0) and this index can be used to specify an entry from Images for display in the DisplayRect.

element.name: TTabControl.OnGetSiteInfo
element.short: OnGetSiteInfo - event handler for getting information about the current site

element.name: TCustomDrawTarget
element.short: Set

element.name: TCustomDrawStage
element.short: Set of constants to define the drawing stages.
element.descr: So far I've only seen cdPrePaint used in this unit.

element.name: TCustomDrawStateFlag
element.short: Set to define the DrawState
element.descr:
TCustomDrawStateFlag consists of the following constants:
cdsSelected,
cdsGrayed,
cdsDisabled,
cdsChecked,
cdsFocused,
cdsDefault,
cdsHot,
cdsMarked,
cdsIndeterminate

element.name: TCustomDrawState
element.short: A subset of TCustomDrawStateFlag
element.descr: TCustomDrawState determines how a item will be drawn.

element.name: TListItem
element.short: TListItem - the ancestor class for the Items in TCustomListView and TListView
element.descr: Most properties are inherited from ancestors, TPersistent and TObject

element.name: TListItem.Delete
element.short: Remove an Item from the list

element.name: TListItem.MakeVisible
element.short: MakeVisible - render the item visible (if PartialOK is True, only part may be visible)

element.name: TListItem.Caption
element.short: Caption - the name given to this item on the list

element.name: TListItem.Cut
element.short: Cut this item from the list (but it can be placed on the clipboard)

element.name: TListItem.Data
element.short: Pointer to the Data asociated with this item

element.name: TListItem.Focused
element.short: Property is true if this item has Focus

element.name: TListItem.Index
element.short: The index of this item in the list (integer)

element.name: TListItem.ImageIndex
element.short: The index of the image associated with this Item in the list

element.name: TListItem.Owner
element.short: The Owner of the ListItem

element.name: TListItem.Selected
element.short: Whether this Item has been Selected (often denoted by a check-mark)

element.name: TListItem.SubItems
element.short: The list of SubItems associated with this ListItem

element.name: TListItem.SubItemImages
element.short: SubItemImages - the list of Images associated with the SubItems

element.name: TListItems
element.short: A list of items with a cache of the last accessed item
element.descr: TListitems has a built-in cache of the last accessed item. This will speed up interface updates since Item.Index is often used for the same item updating more properties. If FCacheIndex = -1 then the cache is not valid.

element.name: TListItems.IndexOf
element.short: Returns the IndexOf the Item specified by AItem

element.name: TListItems.Add
element.short: Add an Item to the Collection

element.name: TListItems.AddItem
element.short: AddItem - add the specified AItem to the collection

element.name: TListItems.Clear
element.short: Clear - remove all Items from the list

element.name: TListItems.Delete
element.short: Remove the Item specified by AIndex from the collection

element.name: TListItems.Insert
element.short: Insert an item in the list at AIndex, returning the value of the ListItem

element.name: TListItems.InsertItem
element.short: InsertItem - procedure to insert AItem at position AIndex in the list

element.name: TListItems.Count
element.short: Count - the number of items in the collection

element.name: TListItems.Item
element.short: An Item in the list, specified by its Index value

element.name: TListItems.Owner
element.short: Owner - the ListView that owns this collection of ListItems

element.name: TWidth
element.short: ImageIndex

element.name: TListColumn
element.short: TListColumn - an individual column in a multi-column List control

element.name: TListColumn.Alignment
element.short: Alignment - whether text is to be left or right justified or centered

element.name: TListColumn.AutoSize
element.short: Whether AutoSize is to be operational

element.name: TListColumn.Caption
element.short: A text string or Caption (which may be translated) to be used at the top of the column

element.name: TListColumn.ImageIndex
element.short: MaxWidth - the maximum permissable width for the column

element.name: TListColumn.MaxWidth
element.short: MaxWidth - the maximum width for this column

element.name: TListColumn.MinWidth
element.short: MinWidth - the minimum permissable with for the column

element.name: TListColumn.Tag
element.short: Tag - a general purpose integer variable to be used in association with this column

element.name: TListColumn.Visible
element.short: Visible - whether this column can be seen

element.name: TListColumn.Width
element.short: The Width of this column

element.name: TListColumns
element.short: TListColumns - a collection of Items of type TListColumn (the columns appearing in a multi-column list)

element.name: TCustomListView
element.short: TCustomListView - the base class for TListView

descr.p: TCustomListView is the base class for TListView. If you want to define your own ListView class, you should derive it from this class.

element.name: TCustomListView.Change
element.short: Change - Internal procedure to simulate the OnChange event

descr.p: This is an internal procedure which is called after an item has been changed. It is a programmatic method for simulating the OnChange event if the programmer has assigned a method to this event.

element.name: TCustomListView.ColClick
element.short: ColClick - procedure to simulate the OnColumnClick event.

descr.p: ColClick - procedure to simulate the OnColumnClick event.
Can be used programmatically to execute the same code as is used to respond to the OnColumnClick event

element.name: TCustomListView.Delete
element.short: Delete an Item from the List

element.name: TCustomListView.InsertItem
element.short: Insert an Item into the List

element.name: TCustomListView.Columns
element.short: Columns - define and change the columns of a ListView

descr.p: Columns is a TCollectionItem and contains all information on the columns of a listview.

element.name: TCustomListView.ColumnClick
element.short: ColumnClick - determines if the OnColumnClick event will be executed.

descr.p: The ColumnClick property of the ListView enables or disables the OnColumnClick Event. A call to OnColumnClick will only be done when a method has been assigned to the OnColumnClick event and ColumnClick is set to true (default).

element.name: TCustomListView.Items
element.short: Items - the list of entries in the list. Held as a linked list with a cached index of the last accessed item

descr.p: Items - the list of entries in the list. Held as a linked list with a cached index of the last accessed item

Items is of type TListitems which has a built-in cache of the last accessed item. This speeds up interface updates since Item.Index is often used for the same item updating more properties. If FCacheIndex = -1 then the cache is not valid.

element.name: TCustomListView.LargeImages
element.short: LargeImages - an ImageList to be used in association with the list of Items

descr.p: LargeImages - an ImageList to be used in association with the list of Items

A typical application might have two ImageLists: one ofLargeImages and one of SmallImages, containing two versions of the same collection of images, in large and small format; the index numbers of the first list would correspond with those in the second list.

SmallImages could be displayed beside the text strings in the list view, and the programmer would supply code to ensure that when an item with its associated SmallImage was selected, the corresponding LargeImage would be displayed in another window.

A TImageList control needs to be selected and pasted on to the Form Designer, and the ImageList Editor can be opened from the pop-up menu obtained by right-clicking on TImageList icon in the Form Designer. Then in the StringList editor for Items the correct ImageIndex must be allocated to each entry in the list.

element.name: TCustomListView.MultiSelect
element.short: MultiSelect - enables the selection of more than one entry from Items - by pressing SHIFT or CTRL keys while selecting

element.name: TCustomListView.ReadOnly
element.short: ReadOnly - determines if the list can only be read, and not written or deleted.

element.name: TCustomListView.ScrollBars
element.short: ScrollBars - the kind of scrollbars to be used: none, auto, horizontal or vertical

element.name: TCustomListView.ShowColumnHeaders
element.short: ShowColumnHeaders - whether headers for columns are to be displayed

element.name: TCustomListView.SmallImages
element.short: SmallImages - an ImageList of small images (icons) to be used in association with the list of Items

descr.p: SmallImages - an ImageList of small images (icons) to be used in association with the list of Items

A typical application might have two ImageLists: one ofLargeImages and one of SmallImages, containing two versions of the same collection of images, in large and small format; the index numbers of the first list would correspond with those in the second list.

SmallImages could be displayed beside the text strings in the list view, and the programmer would supply code to ensure that when an item with its associated SmallImage was selected, the corresponding LargeImage would be displayed in another window.

A TImageList control needs to be selected and pasted on to the Form Designer, and the ImageList Editor can be opened from the pop-up menu obtained by right-clicking on TImageList icon in the Form Designer. Then in the StringList editor for Items the correct ImageIndex must be allocated to each entry in the list.

element.name: TCustomListView.SortType
element.short: SortType - whether to sort by text, by data, both or not at all

element.name: TCustomListView.SortColumn
element.short: SortColumn - the column that is being sorted

element.name: TCustomListView.StateImages
element.short: StateImages - an imagelist of icons to demonstrate the state of a process or event

element.name: TCustomListView.ViewStyle
element.short: ViewStyle - whether to view as a simple list, a list with large or small icons, or as a report

element.name: TCustomListView.OnChange
element.short: OnChange - event handler for a change in the list

element.name: TCustomListView.OnColumnClick
element.short: OnColumnClick - event handler for clicking on a coulmn

element.name: TCustomListView.OnCompare
element.short: OnCompare - event handler for comparing list items

element.name: TCustomListView.OnDeletion
element.short: OnDeletion - event handler for deleting a list item

element.name: TCustomListView.OnInsert
element.short: OnInsert - event handler for inserting list item

element.name: TCustomListView.OnSelectItem
element.short: OnSelectItem - event handler for list item selection

element.name: TCustomListView.BoundingRect
element.short: BoundingRect - the coordinates of the rectangle containing the ListView

element.name: TCustomListView.Canvas
element.short: Canvas - defines the area on which all graphic material is drawn (Read-only)

element.name: TCustomListView.Checkboxes
element.short: CheckBoxes - determines if the ListView shows checkboxes beside the items on the list

element.name: TCustomListView.Column
element.short: Column - reads the column information of the listview.

descr.p: This property can be used to read the information of a column.

The column whose information is to be retrieved is determined by an index (AIndex). As with nearly all indexes, this index is 0 based. In column[0] the caption of the listitem is show, in subsequent column the subitems of the listitem are shown.
To add, change or delete a column use the Columns property

element.name: TCustomListView.Column.AIndex
element.short: Integer to determine the column of the ListView to retreive information on.

element.name: TCustomListView.DropTarget
element.short: DropTarget - location where an item from the list is to be dropped

element.name: TCustomListView.FlatScrollBars
element.short: FlatScrollBars - whether the scroll bars are to be displayed flat

element.name: TCustomListView.GridLines
element.short: Whether GridLines are to be shown

element.name: TCustomListView.ItemFocused
element.short: ItemFocused - the item currently receiving focus

element.name: TCustomListView.RowSelect
element.short: RowSelect - whether the user can select rows of items (across columns). Default false

element.name: TCustomListView.SelCount
element.short: SelCount - the number of items selected

element.name: TCustomListView.Selected
element.short: Selected - the current list item that has been selected

element.name: TCustomListView.TopItem
element.short: TopItem - the first item on the list

element.name: TCustomListView.ViewOrigin
element.short: ViewOrigin - the top left coordinate for the current view

element.name: TCustomListView.VisibleRowCount
element.short: VisibleRowCount - the number of rows visible in the current view (some items might have scrolled outside the window)

element.name: TListView
element.short: TListView - a window showing a list of Items, which may or may not have associated icons

descr.p: TListView - a window showing a list of items, which may or may not have associated icons

At first, this control looks very like TListBox, but it has a much higher degree of complexity. It is capable of displaying Items in Columns of Rows, and it can have images associated with the list Items.

The important information is held in Items, a string-list that can be created using the string-list editor obtained by right-clicking on the ListView in the Form Editor or by clicking on the ellipsis (...) next to the Items entry in the Object Inspector.

A typical application might have two ImageLists: one ofLargeImages and one of SmallImages, containing two versions of the same collection of images, in large and small format; the index numbers of the first list would correspond with those in the second list.

SmallImages (if assigned to a string-list) can be displayed beside the text strings in the list view, and the programmer would supply code to ensure that when an item with its associated Small Image was selected, the corresponding Large Image would be displayed in another window.

One or more TImageList controls need to be selected and pasted on to the Form Designer, and the ImageList Editor can be opened from the pop-up menu obtained by right-clicking on TImageList icon in the Form Designer. The image list can be populated by reading from files. Then in the StringList editor for Items the correct ImageIndex must be allocated to each entry in the list.

element.name: TCustomProgressBar
element.short: The ancestor class for TProgressBar
element.descr: TCustomProgressBar is the ancestor for TProgressBar. If you want to define your own ProgressBar class, you should derive it from this class.

element.name: TCustomProgressBar.StepIt
element.short: StepIt - move indicator to new position (current position plus Step)

element.name: TCustomProgressBar.StepBy
element.short: StepBy - move indicator by amount specified in Delta

element.name: TCustomProgressBar.Max
element.short: Max - maximum value for progressbar

element.name: TCustomProgressBar.Min
element.short: Min - minimum value of progressbar

element.name: TCustomProgressBar.Orientation
element.short: Orientation - horizontal or vertical

element.name: TCustomProgressBar.Position
element.short: Position of indicator along progressbar

element.name: TCustomProgressBar.Smooth
element.short: Whether Smooth display (True) or stepped

element.name: TCustomProgressBar.Step
element.short: Step - size of increment for display

element.name: TCustomProgressBar.BarShowText
element.short: BarShowText - some widget sets allow text to be displayed on the bar to indicate its position (eg 32%)

element.name: TProgressBar
element.short: TProgress Bar - a bar that depicts what proportion of a process has been completed
element.descr: TProgress Bar: a control that appears at or near the bottom of form or window. It depicts the progress of a process, or what proportion of the process is complete. A series of coloured rectangles appears in the control, filling it from left to right or from top to bottom as the process progresses

element.name: TCustomUpDown
element.short: TCustomUpDown - base class for TUpDown - a pair of arrow-like buttons which are used to increment or decrement some controlled variable; often attached to a scroll-bar, but can also control a digital numeric display

descr.p: The control definition itself does not specify the variable upon which the buttons operate. The application programmer is responsible for supplying an event handler for OnClick to determine which button has been selected (designated btNext or btPrev) and incrementing or decrementing the variable in the control with which the UpDown is associated.
The amount by which the variable is changed is set by the integer property Increment with the optional multiplier Thousands (a boolean property).

For example the UpDown control may be used to move a slider up and down a scale by a specified amount for each click; alternatively, a number may be displayed in a text box, and clicking the buttons of the UpDown control may increment or decrement the number displayed by a specified amount.

element.name: TCustomUpDown.OldKeyDown
element.short: OldKeyDown - the previous (stored) value of the key

element.name: TCustomUpDown.AssociateKeyDown
element.short: AssociateKeyDown - protected procedure for dealing with action to be taken if an associate key (Shift, Ctrl or Alt) is pressed while the control is active

element.name: TCustomUpDown.Min
element.short: Min - least value of controlled variable

element.name: TCustomUpDown.Max
element.short: Max - greatest value of controlled variable

element.name: TCustomUpDown.Increment
element.short: The amount by which the controlled variable is to be increased or decreased on each click

element.name: TCustomUpDown.Orientation
element.short: Whether horizontal or vertical

element.name: TCustomUpDown.Position
element.short: The Position of the UpDown control

element.name: TCustomUpDown.Thousands
element.short: If True, multiply all displayed values and the Increment by 1000

element.name: TCustomUpDown.Wrap
element.short: If True, displayed control or value starts again from minimum or maximum value if clicking a button would cause incrementing or decrmenting beyond the extreme value

element.name: TCustomUpDown.OnChanging
element.short: OnChanging - event handler for a change in the value of the controlled variable

element.name: TCustomUpDown.OnClick
element.short: OnClick - special event handler for a click on up or down button

descr.p: The event handler must determine whether the [next] or [prev] button was clicked, and therefore whether to increment or decrement the controlled variable and adjust the display

element.name: TUpDown
element.short: TUpDown - a pair of arrow-like buttons which are used to increment or decrement some controlled variable; often attached to a scroll-bar, but can also control a digital numeric display

descr.p: The control definition itself does not specify the variable upon which the buttons operate. The application programmer is responsible for supplying an event handler for OnClick to determine which button has been selected (designated btNext or btPrev) and incrementing or decrementing the variable in the control with which the UpDown is associated.
The amount by which the variable is changed is set by the integer property Increment with the optional multiplier Thousands (a boolean property).

For example the UpDown control may be used to move a slider up and down a scale by a specified amount for each click; alternatively, a number may be displayed in a text box, and clicking the buttons of the UpDown control may increment or decrement the number displayed by a specified amount.

element.name: CN_DROPDOWNCLOSED
element.short: Message constant.

element.name: TToolButtonStyle
element.short: Determines the style of the tool buttons.

descr.p: These are the possible values of Style:

ul.li: tbsButton - The button appears and functions like a normal button.
tbsCheck - Clicking the button toggles the Down property. Once selected, the button remains selected until clicked again.
tbsDivider - The button appears as a vertical line on the toolbar (used to separate other controls).
tbsDropDown - The button displays a downwards-pointing arrow (suitable for accessing a drop-down menu).
tbsSeparator - The button appears as an empty space on the toolbar (used to separate other controls).

element.name: TToolButtonStyle.tbsButton
element.descr: The button appears and functions like a normal button.

element.name: TToolButtonStyle.tbsCheck
element.descr: Clicking the button toggles the Down property. Once selected, the button remains selected until clicked again.

element.name: TToolButtonStyle.tbsDropDown
element.descr: The button displays a downwards-pointing arrow (suitable for accessing a drop-down menu).

element.name: TToolButtonStyle.tbsSeparator
element.descr: The button appears as an empty space on the toolbar (used to separate other controls).

element.name: TToolButtonStyle.tbsDivider
element.descr: The button appears as a vertical line on the toolbar (used to separate other controls).

element.name: TToolButton
element.short: TToolButton is a button control in a TToolBar object.

descr.p: Use TToolButton to implement buttons on a toolbar. While other controls (including TButton and TSpeedButton) can be placed on toolbars, TToolButton utilizes special toolbar features to simplify the configuration of buttons and offers added display options such as pop-up borders and transparency.
To place tool buttons on a toolbar at design time, select the toolbar, right-click, and choose New Button.

element.name: TToolButton.Index
element.short: Index - the sequence number of the current button in the list of buttons

element.name: TToolButton.Down
element.short: Is this button Down (ie has it been selected)? Default false

element.name: TToolButton.DropdownMenu
element.short: A DropDownMenu that appears when this button is selected

descr.p: A DropDownMenu that appears when this button is selected
It uses the same code as a TPopupMenu, and offers a series of additional menu choices.

element.name: TToolButton.Grouped
element.short: Is this button a member of a group? Default false

descr.p: Is this button a member of a group?

This would mean behaviour similar to the radio buttons in a TRadioGroup, where only one button in the group can be selected, or the check boxes in a TCheckGroup where more than one item can be selected but the members of the group interact in some way.

element.name: TToolButton.ImageIndex
element.short: ImageIndex - the index value of the image from the imagelist to be used with this button

element.name: TToolButton.Marked
element.short: Is this button Marked (ie has it been selected)? Default false

element.name: TToolButton.MenuItem
element.short: The item on the Main Menu with which this tool button is associated

descr.p: The item on the Main Menu with which this tool button is associated
Typically, the buttons on the toolbar would each point to an entry on the menu action list, which could also be accessed by using the Main Menu

element.name: TToolButton.Wrap
element.short: Has this button been wrapped to the next row?

element.name: TToolButton.Style
element.short: Determines the style of the tool button.
element.descr: See TToolButtonStyle for the possible Style values.

element.name: TToolBar
element.short: TToolbar manages tool buttons and other controls, arranging them in rows and automatically adjusting their sizes and positions.

descr.p: TToolbar is a container for tool buttons (TToolButton). it provides an easy way to arrange and manage visual controls.

ul.li: All tool buttons on a toolbar maintain a uniform width and height.
Other controls can sit on a toolbar. These controls (which are held in place by invisible tool buttons) maintain a uniform height.
Controls can automatically wrap around and start a new row when they do not fit horizontally on the toolbar.
The Flat property allows the background to show through the toolbar and gives pop-up borders to the tool buttons.
Spaces and dividers (which are in fact specially configured tool buttons) can group controls on the toolbar both visually and functionally.

descr.p: Typically, the tool buttons correspond to items in an application's menu and gives the user more direct access to the application's commands.

element.name: TToolBar.Buttons
element.short: Lists the tool buttons (TToolButton) in the toolbar.

descr.p: Buttons maintains a list of TToolButton instances. All tool buttons that share a TToolBar parent have the same height and (except for separators and dividers) the same width. Other controls on a toolbar are held in place by invisible separators, which are automatically created and destroyed.

To add tool buttons to the toolbar at design time, select the toolbar, right-click, and choose New Button. To create a space (separator) between one button and the next, select New Separator. To create a divider between buttons, add a button and set its Style propery to tbsDivider. Other controls may be added to the toolbar directly from the Component palette.

element.name: TToolBar.DisabledImages
element.short: The Images on the Image List that are NOT selected for display

element.name: TToolBar.Flat
element.short: Should the toolbuttons be displayed Flat (rather than in relief)? Default false

element.name: TToolBar.HotImages
element.short: The Images on the Image list that are selected for display

element.name: TToolBar.Images
element.short: The Images to be displayed on the buttons

element.name: TToolBar.Indent
element.short: Indent - the amount by which the buttons should be indented Default is 1

element.name: TToolBar.List
element.short: Should the contents of the toolbar be displayed as a List? Default false

element.name: TToolBar.Wrapable
element.short: Wrapable - enables wrapping buttons to the next row if there are too many for the current row

element.name: TCustomTrackBar
element.short: TCustomTrackBar - the base class for TTrackBar

descr.p: TCustomTrackBar defines many of the properties inherited by TTrackBar, a device that allows the user to determine the value of a variable using a quasi-analog slider

element.name: TCustomTrackBar.SetTick
element.short: SetTick - set the interval for ticks on the taskbar (integer)

element.name: TCustomTrackBar.Frequency
element.short: Frequency - how frequently the position of the slider is to be read and updated (currently unsupported)

element.name: TCustomTrackBar.LineSize
element.short: Line-Size - increment for slider position when an arrow key is pressed

element.name: TCustomTrackBar.Max
element.short: Max - the value corresponding to full movement of the slider. Default = 10

element.name: TCustomTrackBar.Min
element.short: Min - the value associated with the minimum slider position. Default = 0

element.name: TCustomTrackBar.OnChange
element.short: OnChange - action to be taken on change in the slider position

element.name: TCustomTrackBar.Orientation
element.short: Orientation - horizontal or vertical

element.name: TCustomTrackBar.PageSize
element.short: PageSize - increment for slider position when PageUp or PageDown key is pressed

element.name: TCustomTrackBar.Position
element.short: Position - the location of the slider along the track bar. Represents the Return value from the control

element.name: TCustomTrackBar.ScalePos
element.short: ScalePos - whether scaling label appears at top, bottom, left or right

element.name: TCustomTrackBar.TickMarks
element.short: Tickmarks - whether the ticks are above/left, below/right, or both
element.descr: Tickmarks - where the ticks appear relative to the bar: above/left, below/right, or both

element.name: TCustomTrackBar.TickStyle
element.short: TickStyle - none, produced automatically, or calculated manually

element.name: TTrackBar
element.short: TTrackBar: a device which allows the user to determine the value of a variable using a quasi-analog slider

descr.p: TTrackBar: a device which allows the user to determine the value of a variable using a quasi-analog slider

The device looks like a slider-potentiometer control on a hi-fi amplifier, and consists of a slider which can be moved along a bar using the mouse. Tick marks can be displayed along one or both edges, giving an indication of the proportion of the maximum value of the controlled variable that is being selected.
The Position property indicates the distance along the bar that the slider has been placed, either by the program or by mouse capture and movement
In the example, movement of the slider is detected and shown in the associated TProgressBar.

element.name: TAddMode
element.short: A set to determine the place where a node should be placed in a tree.

descr.p: This sets consist of three values:
taAdd: Adds the node as the last child.
taAddFirst: Adds the node as the first child.
taInsert: Adds the node in front another node.
This set is used in TTreeNode.InternalMove and TTreeNodes.InternalAddObject

element.name: ETreeNodeError
element.short: Definition of an exception type for errors arising from the code of TTreeView

element.name: ETreeViewError
element.short: Definition of an exception type for errors arising from the code of TTreeView

element.name: NodeAttachModeNames
element.short: A array of strings containings names for NodeAttachModes
element.descr: This is a constant array of string containing names for the modes to attach a node.

element.name: AddModeNames
element.short: An array of strings to store the names for the different TAddModes.

element.name: LCLStreamID
element.short: A constant

element.name: PTreeNodeInfo
element.short: A pointer to TTreeNodeInfo

element.name: PDelphiNodeInfo
element.short: A pointer to TDelphiNodeInfo

element.name: TTreeNode
element.short: TTreeNode is a single item that holds data in TTreeView
element.descr: A TTreeNode is part of a TTreeView and is used for storing data. This can be done by using the Caption property or for more complex data the Data property can be used. Each node can have sibling or child items associated with it.

element.name: TTreeNode.Data
element.descr: Property of type pointer used to store custom data in a node.

element.name: PNodeCache
element.short: Unit used by ComCtrls.

element.name: TTreeNodes
element.short: A collection or list of TTreeNode

element.name: DefaultTreeViewOptions
element.short: A set of TreeViewOptions which are set be default.
element.descr:
These set of options is used to set the options of a TreeView object when first placed on a form. This set consists of the follwoing items:
tvoShowRoot,
tvoShowLines,
tvoShowButtons,
tvoHideSelection,
tvoToolTips,
tvoKeepCollapsedNodes,
tvoAutoItemHeight
For the meaning of this options, see the documentation of TTreeView.

element.name: TCustomTreeView
element.short: TCustomTreeView - ancestor class for TTreeView
element.descr: TCustomTreeView - ancestor class for TTreeView, which displays a collection of items in a hierarchical tree form. This class defines many properties which are inherited by children classes, including loading the data from files or streams, saving to files or streams, updating, sorting alphabetically, editing, making visible or invisible, expanding or collapsing the tree display, and many more.

element.name: TCustomTreeView.AlphaSort
element.short: If True, sort alphabetically

element.name: TTreeView
element.short: TTreeView is a control that displays a hierarchical list of items
element.descr: Use a TTreeView to display a hierarchical list of items. Items are shown by their caption and an optional bitmap.

element.name: TTreeView.Images
element.short: The Bitmap image associated with each item in the display

element.name: TTreeView.Items
element.short: The Items to be displayed in the tree view - ie the actual data

element.name: CompareExpandedNodes
element.short: Function to compare the nodetext two nodes.
element.descr:
This function does an ANSICompare on the NodeText of two nodes. The parameters Data1 and Data2 are pointers to the nodes to be compared. The result is the same is the result from ANSICompareText.
-1: The nodetext from the first node is lower then the nodetext from the second.
0: The nodetext-s from both nodes are equal.
1: The nodetext from the first node is higher then the nodetext from the second.

element.name: CompareTextWithExpandedNode
element.short: Function to compare the give text with the nodetextof the given node.
element.descr:
This function does an ANSICompare on the NodeText of two nodes. The parameters Data1 and Data2 are pointers to the nodes to be compared. The result is the same is the result from ANSICompareText.
-1: The given text is lower then the nodetext from the given node.
0: The given text is equal to the nodetext from the given node.
1: The given text is higher then the nodetext from the given node.

element.name: InitCommonControl
element.short: Function InitCommonControl
element.descr: Implemented for Delphi compatibility, always returns true;

element.name: CheckCommonControl
element.short: Procedure CheckCommonControl.
element.descr: Implemented for Delphi compatibility. Procedure does not execute any code.

element.name: Register
element.short: Procedure used to register the components.

element.name: TCustomHeaderControl
element.short: TCustomHeaderControl - base class for THeaderControl, a header strip of user-designed sections which allow selection of pages or actions

descr.p: TCustomHeaderControl - base class for THeaderControl, a header strip of user-designed sections which allow selection of pages or actions

THeaderControl offers a widget that could be placed along the edge of a Panel or Form, allowing a highly customised mechanism for selection. However, there are no intrinsically associated display areas, and it is the developer's responsibility to supply an index associated with the selection from the THeaderControl and determining what action is to occur or what is to be displayed in any attached Panel or Form.

element.name: THeaderControl
element.short: THeaderControl, a header strip of user-designed sections which allow selection of pages or actions

descr.p: THeaderControl, a header strip of user-designed sections which allow selection of pages or actions

THeaderControl offers a widget that could be placed along the edge of a Panel or Form, allowing a highly customised mechanism for selection. However, there are no intrinsically associated display areas, and it is the developer's responsibility to supply an index associated with the selection from the THeaderControl and determine what action is to occur or what is to be displayed in any attached Panel or Form.

THeaderControl is used by selecting its icon from the Common Controls tab of the IDE Component Palette, and placing it on the Form in the desired position. It may be convenient to dock it with a Form or Panel whose properties it is to be used for controlling.

After size, position, docking, alignment, anchoring etc have been performed using the Object Inspector or Form Designer, the Sections of the Header can be created by selecting the control, right-clicking with the mouse and choosing 'Section Editor'. A Stringlist editor will pop up, with options to add, delete or move entries up or down the list. Each entry is given an Index which can be used in OnClick event handlers to determine the action to be taken when that section is selected at run-time.

element.name: TCustomHeaderControl.PaintSection
element.short: PaintSection - method for painting the current section (specified by Index) of the Header

element.name: TCustomHeaderControl.GetSectionAt
element.short: GetSectionAt - find the index for the section located at point P

element.name: TCustomHeaderControl.DragReorder
element.short: DragReorder - find out if the sections are allowed to be re-ordered by dragging

element.name: TCustomHeaderControl.Images
element.short: Images - the list of Images available for selection using this tool

element.name: TCustomHeaderControl.Sections
element.short: Sections - the short segments of the header, separated by vertical bars, that function as the elementary selection units of the header

element.name: TCustomHeaderControl.OnSectionDrag
element.short: OnSectionDrag - event handler for dragging the section of header

element.name: TCustomHeaderControl.OnSectionEndDrag
element.short: OnSectionEndDrag - event handler for ending the drag process for this section

element.name: TCustomHeaderControl.OnSectionClick
element.short: OnSectionClick - event handler for mouse click on this section of header

element.name: TCustomHeaderControl.OnSectionResize
element.short: OnSectionResize - event handler for re-sizing this section of the header

element.name: TCustomHeaderControl.OnSectionTrack
element.short: OnSectionTrack - event handler for tracking this section

element.name: TCustomHeaderControl.OnSectionSeparatorDblClick
element.short: OnSectionSeparatorDblClick - event handler for double-click on the separator between sections

element.name: TCustomTabControl.IndexOfTabWithCaption
element.short: IndexOfTabWithCaption - returns the index value of the tab that has the specified Caption

element.name: THeaderSections
element.short: THeaderSections - a collection of Items ot type THeaderSection, the individual parts of a THeaderControl

element.name: THeaderSections.AddItem
element.short: AddItem - adds a HeaderSection to the Header at the position specified by Index

element.name: THeaderSections.Items
element.short: Items - the series of individual HeaderSections in the collection

element.name: THeaderSection
element.short: THeaderSection - the individual sections of a THeaderControl, each of which can be used to control its own option, selection etc

element.name: THeaderSection.Left
element.short: The position of the left boundary of the section

element.name: THeaderSection.Right
element.short: The position of the right boundary of the section

element.name: THeaderSection.State
element.short: State - whether normal, hot (ie mouse hovers over it, ready to be selected) or pressed (selected)

element.name: THeaderSection.Alignment
element.short: Alignment - whether text is to be left or right justified or centered

element.name: THeaderSection.ImageIndex
element.short: Index of the image in the imagelist

element.name: THeaderSection.MaxWidth
element.short: Maximum permissable width of a section

element.name: THeaderSection.MinWidth
element.short: Minimum permissable width of a section (default = 0)

element.name: THeaderSection.Text
element.short: The text string that is to appear in the section

element.name: THeaderSection.Width
element.short: The Width of the section that appears on the THeaderControl

element.name: THeaderSection.OriginalIndex
element.short: OriginalIndex - index which doesn't change when the user reorders the sections

element.name: TCustomHeaderControl.OnCreateSectionClass
element.short: OnCreateSectionClass - event handler for creating a new section class

element.name: TCustomListView.ToolTips
element.short: ToolTips - whether Popup tool tips are to be shown

element.name: TCustomListView.Clear
element.short: Clear - the stringlist

element.name: TCustomListView.GetItemAt
element.short: GetItemAt - find the list item at the specified coordinates

element.name: TListItem.Checked
element.short: Checked - if True, a check mark is present beside the item, implying it has been selected

element.name: TListItem.Left
element.short: The position of the Left side of the list item

element.name: TListItem.ListView
element.short: The ListView in which this Item is fould

element.name: TListItem.Position
element.short: The coordinates of the position where the ListItem is located

element.name: TListItem.Top
element.short: The position of the Top of this ListItem

element.name: TListView.HideSelection
element.short: HideSelection - render the selected items invisible

element.name: TStatusBar.OnCreatePanelClass
element.short: Event handler for creating a StatusBar Panel class
